result.execSummary:
All charges against David Wade Lowery in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Wade Lowery is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Wade Lowery

defendant.name: Lowery, David Wade

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM Defendant David Wade Lowery in court/in person with attorney Marina Garza Croft by phone.  Adam T. Stuart appeared for the Wisconsin, State of by phone.
Atty Croft explains case should have been dismissed upon a plea to 21CT53/information from ADA Gabler. Court sees nothing in notes regarding global resolution, local court rule both Courts have to agree.
State notes this case should not have been charged/was an uncharged read-in case and moves to dismiss - Court grants dismissal.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
